title: In Hotel California, what is the 'spirit' referred to in the line ' We haven't had that spirit here since 1969'? - Quora

response.answer_text: I suspect it a reference to the Altamont festival in 1969, in California, after Woodstock, in which a man was murdered by the Hell’s Angels in front of the stage, ending the “hippie era” meme in which close brotherhood between all people was thought possible in America, despite all the political and cultural differences extant among the populace.
If the previous line refers to “please send me my wine” and then he sings about spirit, I think he made a mistake, my opinion. Hotel California - Wikipedia
